type.name: section
type.title: Short title.
type.context: NATIONAL SPORTS COMMISSION ACT under Short title. 1. This Act may be cited as the National Sports Commission Act.
type.description: This Act may be cited as the National Sports Commission Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Interpretation.
type.context: NATIONAL SPORTS COMMISSION ACT under Interpretation. 2. In this Act  the Commission means the National Sports Commission established by section 3;  member means a member of the Commission.
type.description: In this Act  the Commission means the National Sports Commission established by section 3;  member means a member of the Commission.

type.name: section
type.title: Establishment and incorporation of the National Sports Commission.
type.context: NATIONAL SPORTS COMMISSION ACT under Establishment and incorporation of the National Sports Commission. 3. (1) There is hereby established the National Sports Commission which shall be a body corporate.     (2) The provisions of the First Schedule shall have effect as to the constitution and proceedings of the Commission and otherwise in relation thereto.  (3) The Minister may by order amend the provisions of the First Schedule.

description.description: There is hereby established the National Sports Commission which shall be a body corporate.
The provisions of the First Schedule shall have effect as to the constitution and proceedings of the Commission and otherwise in relation thereto.
The Minister may by order amend the provisions of the First Schedule.

type.name: section
type.title: Functions of the Commission.
type.context: NATIONAL SPORTS COMMISSION ACT under Functions of the Commission. 5. Second Schedule.               Advisory units.       Delegation.      by sports organisations referred to in section 20, for funds and resources made available to such organisations;  (j) provide assistance to any sports organisation in the audit  of their accounts or in relation to any other matter wherein assistance may be needed; and  (k) do all such acts and things as are in its opinion necessary for, or conducive to, the proper discharge of its functions.

type.name: section
type.title: Establishment of regional sports committees.
type.context: NATIONAL SPORTS COMMISSION ACT under Establishment of regional sports committees. 6. (1) The Commission may establish regional sports committees in the three counties of Guyana.   (2) The provisions of the Second Schedule shall have effect as to the constitution and proceedings of any regional sports committee and otherwise in relation thereto.  (3) The Minister may by order amend the provisions of the Second Schedule.  (4) Each regional sports committee shall have an office in the region in which it is established.

description.description: The Commission may establish regional sports committees in the three counties of Guyana.
The provisions of the Second Schedule shall have effect as to the constitution and proceedings of any regional sports committee and otherwise in relation thereto.

Each regional sports committee shall have an office in the region in which it is established.

type.title: Advisory units.
type.context: NATIONAL SPORTS COMMISSION ACT under Advisory units. 7. The Commission may establish advisory units to assist it in the performance of its functions, each unit comprising a Chairman, who shall be a member, and not less than five other persons who need not be members.
type.description: The Commission may establish advisory units to assist it in the performance of its functions, each unit comprising a Chairman, who shall be a member, and not less than five other persons who need not be members.

type.name: section
type.title: Remuneration of members of the Commission and regional sports committee.
type.context: NATIONAL SPORTS COMMISSION ACT under Remuneration of members of the Commission and regional sports committee. 9. There may be paid to the members of the Commission and the members of any regional sports committee such remuneration, if may, or allowances, as the Minister may determine.
type.description: There may be paid to the members of the Commission and the members of any regional sports committee such remuneration, if may, or allowances, as the Minister may determine.

type.name: section
type.title: Support and sponsorship of individual sportsmen, athletes and sports teams.
type.context: NATIONAL SPORTS COMMISSION ACT under Support and sponsorship of individual sportsmen, athletes and sports teams. 10. The Commission shall have the power to support and sponsor the participation in events, national, regional or international, of any individual, sportsman or athlete or any sports team, in relation to the national games played in Guyana, the criteria for such support and sponsorship being based on all-round proficiency, performance and sustained effort.

type.name: section
type.title: Employment of staff of the Commission.
type.context: NATIONAL SPORTS COMMISSION ACT under Employment of staff of the Commission. 11. (1) The Commission may, after consultation with the Minister, employ upon such terms and conditions as it thinks fit, a Director of Sports  and such other officers and employees as the Commission deems necessary for the proper carrying out of its functions under this Act.  (2) The Director of Sports shall be the Chief Executive Officer of the Commission, and subject to any general or specific directions of the Commission, be responsible to the Commission for ensuring that the functions of the Commission are properly discharged and objectives achieved.  (3) Notwithstanding the generality of subsection (2) the duties of the Director of Sports shall include responsibility for  (a) managing the Secretariat of the Commission;   (b) managing the funds as directed by the Commission, and preparing quarterly LAWS OF GUYANA 8 Cap. 39:14 National Sports Commission  L.R.O. 1/2012                     Funds and resources of the Commission.                          Borrowing powers of the Commission. financial reports and accounts for presentation at meetings of the commission; (c) causing minutes of meetings to be kept, and   (d) keeping members of the Commission informed, particularly by presenting an activity report at each meeting of the Commission.  (4) The Commission may at any time retain the services of professional persons and pay such remuneration in respect thereof as the Commission after consultation with the Minister, may determine.

type.name: section
type.title: Funds and resources of the Commission.
type.context: NATIONAL SPORTS COMMISSION ACT under Funds and resources of the Commission. 12. The funds and resources of the Commission shall consist of  (a) such sums as may be provided by Parliament;  (b) such monies as may accrue to the Commission from the sale of tickets for any sporting or fund raising activity;   (c) such monies or other assets, as may accrue to or vest in the Commission by way of loans, grants, subsidies, donations or gifts; and  (d) all other sums or property that may in any manner become payable to or vested in the Commission.

type.name: section
type.title: Guarantee by Minister of Finance of borrowing.
type.context: NATIONAL SPORTS COMMISSION ACT under Guarantee by Minister of Finance of borrowing. 14. With the approval of the National Assembly, the Minister responsible for finance may guarantee, in such manner and on such conditions as he may think fit, the payment of the principal and interest on any authorised borrowings of the Commission.
type.description: With the approval of the National Assembly, the Minister responsible for finance may guarantee, in such manner and on such conditions as he may think fit, the payment of the principal and interest on any authorised borrowings of the Commission.

type.name: section
type.title: Audit and report of activities.
type.context: NATIONAL SPORTS COMMISSION ACT under Audit and report of activities. 15. (1) The Commission shall keep proper accounts and other records in respect of its operation which shall be audited annually by the Auditor General.  (2) The Commission shall in each year prepare a report of its activities in the last preceding year and shall furnish such report to the Minister not later than the thirtieth day of June.   (3) A copy of the report of activities together with a copy of the statement of accounts audited shall be printed and laid before the National Assembly not later than the thirtieth day of September in each year.

type.title: Estimates of revenue and expenditure.
type.context: NATIONAL SPORTS COMMISSION ACT under Estimates of revenue and expenditure. 16. The Commission shall, in accordance with the directions of the Minister, submit to the Minister for approval, estimates of revenue and expenditure for the ensuing financial year.
type.description: The Commission shall, in accordance with the directions of the Minister, submit to the Minister for approval, estimates of revenue and expenditure for the ensuing financial year.

type.name: section
type.title: Disclosure of interest.
type.context: NATIONAL SPORTS COMMISSION ACT under Disclosure of interest. 17. It shall be the duty of a member who is in any way, whether directly or indirectly, interested in any contract or any other arrangement with the Commission to declare the nature of his interest at a meeting of the Commission and he shall not take part in any discussion relating to the contract or other arrangement.

type.name: section
type.title: Limitation provisions excluded.
type.context: NATIONAL SPORTS COMMISSION ACT under Limitation provisions excluded. 19. The Limitation Act shall not apply to proceedings instituted by the Commission for the recovery of monies due to the Commission or any other property to which a claim is made by the Commission.
type.description: The Limitation Act shall not apply to proceedings instituted by the Commission for the recovery of monies due to the Commission or any other property to which a claim is made by the Commission.

type.name: section
type.title: Disbursement of funds from Commission to any sports organisation.
type.context: NATIONAL SPORTS COMMISSION ACT under Disbursement of funds from Commission to any sports organisation. 20. (1) No grant from the funds of the Commission shall be made to any sports organisation unless the Commission is satisfied that such organisation does not contravene the provisions of this Act, keeps proper accounts and other records in respect of its operations and is prepared to give the undertaking required under subsection (2).  (2) The Commission may make a grant from its funds to a sports organisation where such organisation complies with the provisions of subsection (1) and gives an undertaking in writing that it would provide the Commission with vouchers verifying that such grant has been utilised for the purpose for which it was made and that the members and employees of such organisation would allow the Commission to inspect the books and accounts of such organisation and give to the Commission on request all other information as shall be within their knowledge in relation to the utilisation of such grant.

type.title: Exemption from taxes and duties.
type.context: NATIONAL SPORTS COMMISSION ACT under Exemption from taxes and duties. 21. The Commission shall be exempt from the payment of customs duty, capital gains tax, corporation tax, income tax, property tax and purchase tax.
type.description: The Commission shall be exempt from the payment of customs duty, capital gains tax, corporation tax, income tax, property tax and purchase tax.

type.name: section
type.title: Vesting of assets.
type.context: NATIONAL SPORTS COMMISSION ACT under Vesting of assets. 22. All property whether movable or immovable (including rights and interests therein) of the State referred to in the Third Schedule is hereby declared to be vested in the Commission from the date of the coming into operation of this Act and in respect of such immovable property so vested in the Commission the Registrar of Deeds shall take due notice thereof and shall make such annotations in the records as may be necessary.
